recipes.name: Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente.
In a separate pan, fry diced pancetta until crispy.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs and grated Parmesan cheese.
Drain cooked spaghetti and add it to the pan with pancetta. Mix well.
Remove from heat and quickly stir in the egg mixture. The residual heat will cook the eggs.
Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Chicken Stir-Fry
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, snap peas)
instructions: Heat sesame oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Add minced garlic and stir-fry until fragrant.
Add sliced chicken breasts and cook until browned and cooked through.
Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
Stir in soy sauce and oyster sauce. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Serve hot over cooked rice.

recipes.name: Classic Margherita Pizza
instructions: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C).
Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface to desired thickness.
Spread pizza sauce evenly over the dough, leaving a small border around the edges.
Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese over the sauce.
Tear fresh basil leaves and scatter them over the cheese.
Drizzle with extra-virgin olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until crust is golden brown and cheese is bubbly.
Slice and serve hot.

recipes.name: Chicken Alfredo Pasta
instructions: Cook fettuccine pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper. In a large skillet, heat butter over medium-high heat.
Add chicken breasts and cook until golden brown on both sides and cooked through. Remove from skillet and set aside.
In the same skillet, add minced garlic and cook until fragrant.
Pour in heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Stir in grated Parmesan cheese until melted and sauce has thickened.
Slice cooked chicken breasts and return to the skillet. Stir in cooked fettuccine pasta until well coated.
Season with additional salt and pepper if needed. Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.

recipes.name: Beef Tacos
ingredients: Sour cream and salsa for serving
instructions: In a skillet, cook ground beef over medium heat until browned. Drain excess fat.
Add taco seasoning mix and water to the skillet. Stir well to combine.
Simmer for 5-7 minutes, or until sauce thickens.
Warm flour tortillas according to package instructions.
To assemble tacos, place a spoonful of beef mixture onto each tortilla.
Top with shredded cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, onions, and chopped cilantro.
Serve with sour cream and salsa on the side.

recipes.name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (broccoli, bell peppers, carrots, snap peas)
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Add minced garlic and stir-fry until fragrant.
Add mixed vegetables and stir-fry until tender-crisp.
Stir in soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.
Serve hot over cooked rice.

recipes.name: Chocolate Cake
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9-inch round cake pans.
In a large mixing bowl, sift together flour, sugar, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Add eggs, milk, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract to the dry ingredients. Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes.
Stir in boiling water until well combined. The batter will be thin.
Pour batter evenly into prepared cake pans.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Remove cakes from oven and let cool in pans for 10 minutes. Then, transfer to wire racks to cool completely.
Frost with chocolate frosting if desired. Slice and serve.

recipes.name: Apple Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large bowl, combine sliced apples, granulated sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, and lemon juice. Toss gently to coat.
Line a 9-inch pie plate with bottom pastry; trim even with edge.
Fill with apple mixture; dot with butter.
Roll out remaining pastry to fit top of pie. Place over filling. Trim, seal, and flute edges. Cut slits in pastry.
Beat egg white until foamy; brush over pastry. Sprinkle with additional sugar.
Bake for 40-45 minutes, or until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbly. If necessary, cover edges with foil during the last 15 minutes to prevent overbrowning.
Cool on a wire rack. Serve warm or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Cheesecake
ingredients: 3 packages (8 ounces each) cream cheese, softened
instructions: Preheat oven to 325°F (160°C).
In a small bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and 1/4 cup sugar; stir in melted butter.
Press onto the bottom of a greased 9-inch springform pan. Place on a baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.
In a large bowl, beat cream cheese and 1 cup sugar until smooth. Beat in eggs, one at a time. Beat in sour cream and vanilla.
Pour filling over crust. Return pan to the baking sheet.
Bake for 50-55 minutes, or until center is almost set.
Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Carefully run a knife around the edge of the pan to loosen; cool 1 hour longer.
Refrigerate overnight. Remove sides of pan. Serve chilled.

recipes.name: Chocolate Mousse
instructions: In a microwave-safe bowl, melt chocolate and butter; stir until smooth. Cool slightly.
In a small bowl, beat egg yolks until thick and lemon-colored. Gradually add sugar, beating well. Stir in chocolate mixture.
In another bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form; fold into chocolate mixture.
In a small bowl, beat cream until it begins to thicken. Add vanilla; beat until soft peaks form. Fold into chocolate mixture.
Spoon into dessert dishes. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours, or until set.

recipes.name: Banana Bread
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour a 9x5-inch loaf pan.
In a large mixing bowl, beat together melted butter and sugar until well combined.
Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in vanilla extract, mashed bananas, and buttermilk.
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Gradually add dry ingredients to the banana mixture, stirring just until combined. Fold in chopped nuts if using.
Pour batter into prepared loaf pan.
Bake for 60-70 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely before slicing.

recipes.name: Lemon Bars
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9x9-inch baking pan.
In a medium bowl, mix together 1 cup flour, softened butter, and 1/4 cup powdered sugar. Press into the bottom of the prepared pan.
Bake for 15-20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until firm and golden.
In another bowl, whisk together eggs, granulated sugar, 2 tablespoons flour, lemon juice, and baking powder until well combined.
Pour over the baked crust and return to the oven.
Bake for an additional 20-25 minutes, or until the lemon topping is set and lightly browned.
Allow to cool completely in the pan on a wire rack.
Once cooled, dust with powdered sugar and cut into squares before serving.

recipes.name: Berry Crisp
ingredients: 4 cups mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, raspberries, blackberries)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9x9-inch baking dish.
In a large bowl, combine mixed berries, granulated sugar, and lemon juice. Toss gently to coat.
In another bowl, mix together oats, flour, brown sugar, and salt. Stir in melted butter until well combined.
Spread berry mixture evenly into the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle oat mixture over the berries.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until the topping is golden brown and the berries are bubbling.
Allow to cool slightly before serving. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream if desired.

recipes.name: Key Lime Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
In a medium bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and melted butter. Press onto the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch pie plate.
Bake for 8-10 minutes, or until set and lightly browned. Remove from oven and cool on a wire rack.
In another bowl, whisk together sweetened condensed milk, key lime juice, and egg yolks until well combined.
Pour mixture into the cooled crust.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, or until filling is set but still slightly jiggly in the center.
Remove from oven and cool completely on a wire rack.
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours, or until chilled and set.
Garnish with whipped cream and lime slices before serving.
